text.text_translated: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, humans began to make cave paintings. These paintings provide evidence of early human civilisation, but we do not know whether this development was linked to language. During this time, their brains did not suddenly grow larger, but humans became more complex and intelligent. Was it using language that helped their brains to develop? Or did their brains become more and more complex and start to produce language?

best_attempt.text_translated: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, humans began to make cave paintings, which provide evidence of early human civilisation; however, we do not know whether this development was linked to language. Although their brains did not suddenly grow larger, humans became more complex and intelligent during this period. This raises the question of whether it was the use of language that caused their brains to develop or whether their increasingly complex brains started to produce language.
